The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by small, fleshy berries that are red when mature. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
